messages.subject: Apology was Opportunites for Experience
messages.msgSnippet: ... thought. ... That s ok Robyn.  I m glad it wasn t meant that way.  No one likes to feel dismissed.  I did want to say thanks for the note at the end of
messages.messageBody:
> I'm so very sorry Nanci, I sure didn't mean to minimize your
>concerns or issues, although now I see that is how it came out.
> Far from intending that, I was trying to offer some praise and
>encourage to you to appreciate yourself for all the good things you
>are clearly already doing. Thanks for the gentle redirection of
thought.
> I hope the new Unschooling group you found works out.
> Robyn L. Coburn

That's ok Robyn. I'm glad it wasn't meant that way. No one likes to
feel dismissed. I did want to say thanks for the note at the end of
your post about trusting myself. I could probably stand to do that a
bit more, and it's always nice to hear that someone thinks I am doing
a pretty good job overall, although I don't live for the approval of
others. I am hoping that the new unschooling group at least produces
a couple new friends, ideally for all of us.

Nanci K.
